thread.title: 'Hot felon' Jeremy Meeks shows off buff body at New York Fashion Week after turning his life around
thread.title_full: 'Hot felon' Jeremy Meeks shows off buff body at New York Fashion Week after turning his life around

author: Zoe Shenton
title: 'Hot felon' Jeremy Meeks shows off buff body at New York Fashion Week after turning his life around
text:
'Hot felon' Jeremy Meeks shows off buff body at New York Fashion Week after turning his life around The 6ft1 model blue-eyed hunk was snapped up by an agent months after being released from prison Share Jeremy Meeks models during New York Fashion Week (Photo: REX) Share Get   
He became a viral hit in 2014 after a police department released his pouting mugshot on its Facebook page. 
Fast forward three years, and Jeremy Meeks is now walking runways during New York Fashion Week. 
On Monday, the blue-eyed hunk was pictured posing backstage Philipp Plein show at the Public Libary. 
The hot dad was flashing his buff body and extensive tattoo collection as he stood against a wire fence and stared seductively into camera. 
Back on the runway, he was modelling a lot more as he strutted his stuff in a black puffa jacket with fur lined hood and black trousers. Jeremy Meeks at the Philipp Plein show at NYFW (Photo: FilmMagic) Jeremy Meeks at the Philipp Plein show at NYFW (Photo: FilmMagic) Jeremy Meeks at the Philipp Plein show at NYFW (Photo: FilmMagic) 
After being released from Mendota Federal Correctional Institution in Northern California in March of last year, Jeremy kicked off his modelling career. 
He soon landed himself an agent and manager, Jim Jordan of White Cross Management in Los Angeles, who claimed to have been "inundated" with offers of work and said at 6ft1 and with his chiselled goodlooks - he was perfect model material. Jeremy Meeks on the catwalk   Jeremy Meeks on the catwalk   
And he wasn't wrong - he now lives in a luxury mansion and owns a £120K sports car after turning his life around. 
Last month, he shared a shot of himself standing at the wheel of a £120,000 Maserati that was parked in the driveway of his plush property. 
He captioned the snaps: "Good to be home - God is good." 
Candid snaps also showed his happiness at being reunited with his family. (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy Meeks) 
One image shows him hanging out in a plush kitchen with one of his young sons, who he affectionately termed 'mini-me' , and another showed him with his partner as they celebrated their anniversary. 
"Celebrating our 8 year anniversary today and 50 more to go," he captioned the sweet photo. Like us on Facebook
